rpaoPdFuyx0e2Z0D7gqCmg.review_text: Love this place!!! Always have the best experiences here! Good music, dancing, drinks. It's everything you could ask for.

OlPYG_Qmw-X-cxupPDF2Sg.review_text: I came to Monroe on 10/19/12 Friday for my birthday celebration. Most of us arrived before 11 to make the guest list just in case there would be a line. Luckily, there was no line at all. I did get bottle service, but you're only allowed 8 guests per bottle (who are able to come at any time).   I was excited to see the lounge as the pictures on the website are beautiful. & was upset when they closed off half the lounge with curtains. My guess is that it was a slower night so if the whole lounge was open, it'd look empty and may shy away potential patrons.   We had the W couches, and because no one else purchased bottle service in that section it was basically all our space. Plenty of room to sit and lounge around. They played EDM, not really sure how to dance to it so I stayed put at the couches. Our hostess came by every now and then to pour drinks for us. I couldn't find her anywhere when we wanted to order a second bottle. But the security went around and found her so she could finally take our order and allow 4 guests to come in for free after guest list ended. We figured if we buy another bottle, we should be allowed the "8 guests/bottle rule" and they obliged.   It wasn't the type of club where you can't breathe or walk around. I like being able to walk through the crowd without getting pushed or my foot stepped on. Although on a random note, I did find it weird that one of the bathroom stalls did not have a door (only two stalls in the bathroom). Other than that we had a great time partying at Monroe.

ZRPLaDjJJ3ebJFQL5MIO_g.review_text: I came back to Monroe last night for another BLAP Productions event and I have to say this time was even better than the last.  As opposed to my visit before, last night the bartenders were great and really friendly even though they were busy since the place was packed.  Definitely try to get here early (10ish) since the place really fills up. Also it's worth it to get on the guest list.  And guys, there is a dress code so leave your sneakers at home.

-LT26P5QMdadkD2sit_PaQ.review_text: I have never felt so strongly about a place to write a yelp review, so maybe you won't take anything i write to heart, but:  this place was ridiculous. management needs to rethink their policies. four tables reserved and bottle service for 3 peoples' joint birthdays. they were told they had an unlimited guestlist, which had a separate reservation code than the normal guestlist. What's the point when you won't let anyone in?   A group of us, including the bday girl who's card was down for all the tables got there about 11, and initially they were only going to let her in. The rest of us had to wait in line. Eventually they allowed ONLY the girls in, and the boys all had to wait in line. Anyone on our guestlist who wasn't with us at that time had to wait--to the point where half our party just gave up. i had separate friends who managed to get in and were wondering why the entire back section was open. seriously, who do you think you are? be warned anyone who's thinking about buying a table here, either get there early, or expect to be treated no differently than anyone else.  in their defense, it was fun once monroe took the stick out of their ass and let in a few more of our friends. it's pretty swank, and if it weren't for the absolutely stoOPid [lack-of] VIP service we received, i probably would've given it 4 stars.   i think the birthday kids deserve an apology.

cMSprRe3-eQREYOGCDmabQ.review_text: Thank God I yelped this place!  Spent my birthday here last night.  IT IS BY FAR THE CLEANEST LOUNGE IN SF I'VE EVER STEPPED FOOT IN. This place is pretty well kept. Music was awesome! Top 40/house. Crowd was sophisticated. None of the ghetto-fabNOT you will find next door. The decor was amazing. I thought it was just a bit too dark inside.   Now for bottle service, spent about $375 for one bottle of grey goose. That includes tax plus the 20% percent gratuity I have to include for our server. Which i am going to give - minus 1 star. She was hardly at our table. We pretty much had to pour our own drinks. She was basically MIA 90% of the night.  My sober friends can attest to that. And if I remember your service. It's either you did really great or you did really bad. So yeah, it was painful  to give 20% percent gratuity for a server who was barely there. *shrugs*  Other than that the bouncers were nice, it was a breeze getting in.  I had to put my guests names on the guest list and arrived there around 10:15 so line wasn't long YET.  Overall aside from the shitty server. This place deserves to be in the top lounges in SF to visit. My friends all had a good time

wwNlLUz1E4V2l37nmC_f9Q.review_text: As Far as Clubs in this area - definitely as good as it gets! Classy interior, reasonable drinks prices, enough room for everyone even though the place get's pretty busy so make sure to arrive early. I was very nicely surprised and would definitely recommend this place to everyone who wants to have fun int the city!

LGT35j0YvjsfRX09nJ3eWA.review_text: i would still never go back here!

_-svlLztTUtuVQkh0TPSrw.review_text: I'm going to start off my review by being honest and revealing I might be a little biased, I am a DJ my crew and I have DJed here about 4 or 5 times so I will give more of behind the scenes review.        One of the biggest things I love about this club is the decor, Old Hollywood prohibition type setting with antique looking lighting (while the place is lit up) and awesome pictures/portraits hung up everywhere. Take one look at the gallery on their website, when you show up, you won't be disappointed.         From a DJ standpoint, the club is great, they have a super nice and clean sound system, people really don't know how big of a deal this is for a club, if they put the time to make sure their sound and DJ gear is top notch, then they obviously pay attention to detail and care about their club (I've spun at another bay area club [I won't name names] where their gear was super ghetto and another DJ admitted that someone probably spilled a beer into one of the turntables). They just got a few new LED lights that really highlight the VIP areas and they have a couple moving LED effects that hit the dancefloor as well. I'd say a few more LED's to highlight the booths and maybe a couple scanners or moving heads would really make this place come to life (not that our music doesn't do that already ;)      )             Drinks! The bartenders/staff I've dealt with are Payam and Ali. Both guys are cool and pour great drinks, the drinks are reasonably priced and it's nice not having to spend 5 minutes leaning across the bar trying to flag down the bartender, they're always really quick and attentive. As far as security guys, they are all really cool/chill, they are NOTHING like a lot of bouncers you will find at other clubs who are dudes on a power trip, one of the nights I was working here, some girl came up to me almost crying because some a-hole spilled a drink on her, I asked on of the security guys to come over, he talked to her, she pointed him out and they kept an eye on him, as soon as he was being belligerent and rude again, whoosh! They booted him, awesome.        Last but not least, the crowd. From the few different events here I've seen an eclectic mix of people, a good mix of mainly 20/30 somethings dressed up, or in nice jeans, and from what I've seen everyone seems very well behaved and non-ghetto compared to so many other establishments, a perfect combination of classy/non snobby/people who don't take themselves too seriously, it's very refreshing. The area is definitely an interesting place to park, as someone who's had my car stolen AND broken into in the last 2 years in SF, I always just drop $20 on the parking lot right across the street. If you stay till close to closing I'd recommend leaving maybe 20 minutes before the place shuts down, I'm usually the closing DJ and I end up being the DD who drives my friends home, I usually don't get to my car until 2:15, and by then it is a MAD HOUSE, tons of drunk crazy people out on the streets at the same time when all the bars close down, I always hate walking to my car/driving away through the crowds, so I would recommend leaving a lil early to avoid the craziness.  All in all Monroe is a newer lounge (they JUST had their 1 year weekend celebration) that is a really good blend of class and fun without the ghetto or pretentiousness of other places and worth checking out!

W1WQekJ9adEKBikkhCKayQ.review_text: If you want to go to a place where the bouncer attempts to bounce a birthday boy who reserved four tables to the back of the line, then come here.   If you want to go to a place where you expect to have fun because your friends dropped a lot of money to reserve the whole back space, but you end up having to wait outside for a good amount of time because of an incompetent bouncer, then come here.  If you want to go to a place that lacks good music and energy, then come here.  The night was tainted for a good number of our group because of terrible customer service experience and not-so-great music. You only have one chance to make a good first impression, and Monroe failed miserably. Never coming back here.

QjkYh8mqH43UkG51e58bUA.review_text: I went here for a friend's birthday celebration on a Friday night. The cover was free for everyone before 10 pm which is always good. The place was pretty small too and can get really crowded quickly as the night goes on. The bar was also decent sized and the bartender was really friendly. She was fun and gave us some great drinks! Also, happy hour lasts until 10 pm.   On this night, the DJ was whack! The music stopped completely on 4 different occasions and the variety was bad. At one point, it was all 90s R&B, then to EDM, then to 70s music. For a crowd that's mostly young adults, the vibe was mixed as some people were liking the music or people were absolutely hating it. This was my first night here so maybe it was a one time thing.  This is a decent lounge. The music wasn't the greatest but I met some fun people and still had a great time! The decor was nice and the drinks were good. I had a decent experience and will give it another shot some time.

Ve6Yq7F9Chf8N0JuJ7cQ2g.review_text: Rosana showed me great customer service & I want to thank her for a great time at Monroe for my birthday Oct 2012.  Few things I would like to say.  In the beginning  things were really confusing & a little irritating.  At first when I got to the line, bouncers knew who I was & my situation right away, which was great! Problem was just moving around from one booth to another & not even having my own private space.  We had to share with another party.  I mean I guess it was fine, I just thought since I had 15 people come, we'd have a bigger spot, but I guess they did they're best.  Bottle service comes first & I was one that didn't request it. Luckily, the party next to us knew we were sharing & they were really nice about it. The place looks awesome & I would definitely mark this club as one places I would come back to, because of nice staff &  venue.  One more thing though, I wish there were seating for the public, if  people didn't have a booth.  I know some clubs don't do that, but it really would give more feedback to help the clubs.  Still a good place tough.

eKJgihPCWs1xyeKqn1a_2Q.review_text: I had a pretty good time at this venue(due to the overflowing booze), but there were some hiccups with communication along the way. It's stressful planning any party, esp a friend's surprise Bday party.  I contacted Monroe regarding bottle service on a Thursday and nobody got back to me until the following Tuesday. Even until then, it was extremely difficult getting a hold of my promoter(Rosanna) and nothing was set in stone until 2 days before the party.  But aside from that, the transaction went relatively smooth.  Now, onto the actual venue. We didn't have any trouble getting in through bottle service although everyone had to individually sign up on the Glist with the bottle service code. Once inside, we were greeted by a cute waitress(too faded to remember her name, sorry), who brought our drinks right away. There was also a wheelchair in front of our table. I thought: "how thoughtful! It's for the drunk ppl who need to be wheeled out at the end of the night!" Come to find out, it was for a disabled person next to our table. After a couple of drinks, our table started sitting in the wheelchair and rolling around in it ( including myself). Security guards got angry and took it away. Come on! Why put a wheel chair right IN FRONT of our table and expect drunk ppl to NOT play with it!  I got a few good wheelies in before they took it away though. ;)  So my friends and I are having a good time- we're drinking, dancing, laughing, talking, taking pics, the normal stuff you do at clubs. The security guard comes over TWICE to tell us to keep it down because we were drawing attention to ourselves. WTF?!?!  Don't you want people to see that your customers are having a GOOD time so more people will come to your venue?!  I will never understand the shush thing at a club, maybe the old disabled guy complained? I did see a couple of 70 year olds at this place though.....  Overall, I had a great time,with awesome company. One star for the cute bouncer, one star for the wheelchair, and one star for not losing my shoes. =)  HAPPY BDAY MARZ BARZ!!!

Eq3mNcLDCrlJrRqweLWL6A.review_text: I stumbled (really, I did stumble as I was piss drunk) upon Monroe's after drinking way too many scorpion bowls at the Bamboo Hut right next door. As we were walking by, we saw a few posters that advertised a Battle of The Decades DJ battle which had the CHEAPEST drink prices I've ever seen for a Friday night. Basically, the drink prices are something like $1 for the 70s and then $2 for the 80s, $3 for the 90s, and it goes up like that every hour. By the time you reach the 'aughts, it's still cheaper than 99% of bars in this city. It was all free so we popped in and had ourselves a hell of a night reliving the decades.  Cheap booze aside, the atmosphere is surprisingly mellow and inviting. Lots of nice people on the Friday night we went. Given the cheap alcohol, you'd expect more drunk people falling all over themselves but everyone appeared to hold their liquor well. Biggest bonus: The bathrooms have more than 1 stall! Bathrooms are my thang and I like to have more than 1 stall as I have a tiny bladder and like to drink a lot so I was thrilled upon entering the bathroom and seeing stalls plural.  Security guards aren't too aggressive, everyone has a spot to dance. The club space is big enough but you won't get lost in it. The crowd was pretty diverse the night I went - it's nice to be in a San Francisco bar/club that isn't just white hipsters or techie nerds Google Glassing all over the damn place (sorry, but you know it's true). It did seem like a lot of out-of-towners but for the most part, people kept to themselves and enjoyed the music and cheap booze.  I'll be back for the 80's!

3qMnJT5k3sSA565d7N4r6A.review_text: I"ve come here twice now and had a great time both nights!  They play great music to help you dance the night away!  I lot of hip-hop with some top 40/ dance songs mixed in.  The space is decently big but on slow nights they close half the place with a big velvet curtain.  This is my new go-to spot anytime I'm out in North Beach!

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: This place is pretty spacious and play house music on the weekends. Cover is only 10 a night. Drinks are cheap.  Mixed crowd.

eSdQJJx3s-4uKS9ofr0zhw.review_text: Try to rip us off?  PLEASE.  Okay well, you almost did.  Party group of 20 girls, we reserved a 2 tables.  There's a drink minimum of 2 bottles, no problem.  $350, sure okay,  no biggie.  When we get there we order 2 bottles of Grey Goose.  We were all chatting away, we didn't think much or even glance when they dropped off the bottles in the ice buckets.  The bartender/server girl poured us the first round we drink.. okay.  (I only drink 2-3x a year FYI).  My girlfriend asks me is that Grey Goose, I said yeah look at it.  She mentions it tastes fruity, different.  I don't pay attention too much since all alcohol tastes like crap to me.   The rest of the girls show up, and mind you these girls know their alcohol.  Immediately after tasting the "Grey Goose" they said.. "This is NOT Grey Goose."  She brings it up to the server girl, and next thing you know it, was have 1 "comped" Grey Goose bottles, that were given to us sealed.  SEALED.  Shame on us for not asking for sealed bottles to begin with.  Other then this hiccup.. a HUGE hiccup I'd like to add, the place is cool.  Dance floor, mature adults.  Just make sure you get sealed bottles when getting table service, I don't even wanna think about the drinks at the bar.  If they are serving us water downed vodka, I imagine the same at the bar.  (Eeeek!)  The owner messaged me and in all fairness, this is his message.  Copy and pasted.   I would appreciate it if you would be truthful in your write up. There is not a two bottle minimum per table. You had two tables but decided to have both bottles on one table. We also did not comp both bottles for you. When there was a complaint about the taste I asked the waitress to switch the bottle out and make sure give you sealed one to prove it was Grey Goose. That is the only reason why it came to you sealed. We always put a pour spout on bottles for guests. The only thing that was comped was a smaller bottle of Grey Goose because I thought you were getting two bottles for one table and we usually discount the second bottle. I did not know you had both brown booths for your group. So to make sure you were getting a discount I comped the third small bottle. I hope I am not getting punished for making sure we give good customer service and being generous. All the actions we took was to make sure our guests were satisfied with their experience. I would appreciate it if you could take that into consideration. If you would like to talk about this directly please do not hesitate to call me.  Nonetheless, still request sealed bottles when receiving table service.

_UMTGara5YnzRIey3Mva0Q.review_text: For us old timers...this used to be the famous "Dragon Bar."  Now it is updated and renovated, with some cool walls, nicer floors, and much much nicer bars.  Very nice place for happy hour, and you won't feel like a skanky college student looking for the $5 admission and cheap drinks anymore...  Hey, we are all grown up now...and so is the Dragon Bar.  Tip: Go when DJ Carol C is spinning!!!  She plays great house music.

Rp0U_4jxK4dBAbeTmpT1Ug.review_text: I checked out Monroe last night during their "soft opening" just after work.  There were a few others in there excited to check out the new spot, but it certainly wasn't crowded.  Monroe is positioned on Broadway between stripclubs in the the FD/North Beach/Chinatown-ish district (the bartender said the area was "up and coming" for new bars/club - it's a stone's throw from 15 Romolo, BTW, for high-end bar-hopping).  The lounge area is lavishly decorated with plush booths that scream for a table tent reading: "Reserved for Bottle Service." At least that's what popped into my mind as I walked through the space.    I sat at the bar with a friend to sample a couple of their specialty cocktails, all priced around $10.  I don't remember the names, but one was served up in a martini glass and had cucumber, watermelon and gin, and my second drink was some sort of tasty tequila concoction served on the rocks with a salt rim.  Following my two drinks, I had a decent buzz so while they tasted good, they were definitely strong too (no complaints here on that front!).  Both used super-fresh ingredients, too, which I always prefer and appreciate.   The bar was decorated with round leather bar stools and bowls filled with fresh fruit for garnishing and concocting cocktails.  One note for the ladies -- there are no under-the-bar-purse-hooks.  Management - this is a quick fix you could easily install for the ladies visiting your bar so we don't have to hold our purse or (worse) put it on the floor.   I can picture this place going off on a Saturday night and would be interested in checking it out again once traffic picks up following its grand opening.

BK3Jt6vp8iIxbX9Wl6YPeQ.review_text: Came here to celebrate my friend's 25th birthday.  The venue is a bit small, but nice vibe.  There is two bars and one smoke area which is handy if you decide that you need to take a smoke break. Being that I don't smoke, I used the area for some air b/c Monroe doesn't have amazing ventilation and it gets a bit hot after dancing.  Get on the guestlist b/c otherwise its a $20 cover which I am sure most would rather spend that on drinks. :) Overall, fun place to check out, just make sure to get here a bit earlier b/c parking is tricky since its in the north beach area.

nJ0hGm8V-vbIcCc9-NgzEg.review_text: definitely enjoyed this grand opening last night.  the vibe, music, and overall feel of the spot are all top notch.  this is the old dragon bar, but from what i can tell, the 4 walls are the only thing that still remain.  this new spot is great for a chill happy hour, night of drinking, celebrating, whatever! i'll definitely be back.

qKyIlflser6loAN-UpSmng.review_text: A friend and I decided to be adventurous and try a new spot to grab drinks and maybe dance. We hung around Monroe from about 10:45 - 11:45pm on a Saturday night hoping for some fun, but it was totally dead. The DJ was actually playing some great music, but there were so few people there it would have felt a bit awkward to dance. The drinks were fine but nothing special.   If not for the fact that the ladies' room was missing a door on one of the stalls (forcing me to wait while a few ladies in the other stall finished doing something of questionable legality) and the fact that the sofas were very damp & coming apart at the seams and the fact that it was totally dead yet somehow the people who were there tended toward the sleazy drunk hitting on you repeatedly types, I might deem this a decent place to meet up for drinks and dancing. Unfortunately, those things were all a part of my experience at Monroe, and I won't be going back.

PpNZuICTyx3DSH-v_zmbWw.review_text: oOooo.., fresh new lounge to hit the Broadway scene. It's all nice and done up. Word on the street is they just opened up earlier this year. It's definitely worth checking out. Synergy hosted a party there and we got in with no problems or anything. I like the inside feel of the place... very sleek and new. Not a huge dancefloor, but it's manageable.

CDZWiihsmtiP-cgBRSSljA.review_text: Just as we arrived for happy hour last Wednesday, they were out putting up a sign for a "Private Event."  During Happy Hour. :(  We had just walked up from the FiDi to check it out, but it looks like it'll have to wait for another post-work night out on the town.

w0Qqa2YsjrW70u66d_sZiQ.review_text: Came here on Friday night to celebrate my sister's birthday! We got there at almost 10 and the place had a decent amount of people. Went up to the bar and ordered some drinks. They were very strong. Holy shit. Then we made our way to our table. We had an area roped off for us for bottle service and the set up is pretty nice! Wrap around couches, some tablesand some grehat wall decor. The girl that brought out the bottles was super fun and was great at pumping up everyone and she actually came back to check on us numerous times, which I totally appreciated. She even brought us water constantly. She was great! The club itself was fun! I actually think watching other people dance was more fun. Just imagine all of the world's most awkward dancers all on one dance floor. And they were all white. Like, I don't know how else to describe it. It was just so white. Not necessarily a bad thing, I'm just not used to it. Like imagine a club scene in a disneychannel movie. That was Monroe. It was fun but by 12:45, the club completely died out. Like there were maybe 20-30 people in the club total including our group of 12. So sad it died out so soon, the DJ was actually doing pretty good.  It was a decent experience.

ZhATZtcAivCoCVCup3VSeQ.review_text: I attended the Grand Opening party with free cocktails and passed appetizers. It was a really nice party.  I like the vibe of this place.   The cocktails were really nice, but the bartenders were a little slow. It was opening night and it wasn't crowded, so I'm not sure what the deal was. Apparently they kept running out of the batches of ingredients they had prepared. It's okay; I'm sure they will get quicker. The bartenders were nice!  The appetizers were nice, but the servers weren't. They were a little rude and they kept dodging people, stepping on toes and throwing 'bows. I'm not sure if these ladies were bar staff or hired help for the night, but I overheard many different groups of people complaining about them. I surely hope they aren't affiliated with the bar. They were definitely the sour note of the night.    The decor was definitely the highlight! It is really nice! This place has a classy old Hollywood meets 50's pin-up feel. I love the portraits on the curtains that adorn the walls. There's also giant round booths that easily fit 8 people, which I'd have to see how they translate on a crowded night. There didn't seem to be much other seating besides the big booths. You'll definitely get to know your booth mates if you come in a small group.   There's a nice semi-private, elevated area with a few booths and tables by the DJ booth. This area would be ideal for a party!   There's also a covered, outdoor smoking patio with outdoors heaters. My friends enjoyed this patio; it was a little too smoky for me though. It sits on the street which makes for excellent people watching while you chill out for a sec.   I met one of the owners, and she was really nice as well. I wish them the best of luck on their new venture! I'll have to return to see what the ambiance and crowd is like on regular night.

JWQe8stuylRF5AG7gX4BxA.review_text: I've only been here for Happy Hour so this is what my review is based off of.   As a wine lover, this place was perfect for a glass. Me along with my two guests were the only ones in the joint. This made our exprience very one on one with the place as well as with the bartender. The Bartender helped me choose what was good, and also gave me a taste of some of the wines.   I loved the decor, absolutely chic. Will go back ASAP!

TPVYynTdO4Vs0d89kS5bXg.review_text: I came here for my 31st bday and had such a blast.  The door guys are really cool and easy going.  The bartenders are fun, efficient and quick.  The crowd was perfect. 20's-mid 30's well dressed crowd.  Everyone was there to have a good time and that was all.  The decor is really nice and cozy chic.  Out of place among the surrounding establishments, but no biggie at all.

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: Friend and I stopped in post-run one Tuesday and it was pretty empty. Food took forever to come out (we just got a flatbread) and they seemed to be out of a lot of wines we asked for. The bartender was a bit standoff-ish at first and eventually warmed up. We ended up spending entirely too much money for what we got. Oh, and there were way too many creepy/sketchy potential strip club owners/goers that stopped in.  I will say the decor is awesome. That's about it.
